content.question:
<math alttext="M g C l 2, aqueous, plus, 2 N a O H, aqueous, react to produce, 2 N a C l, aqueous, plus, M g, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mtext>g</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>â†’</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Mg</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
A <math alttext="100 milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="0.1 Molar M g C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and a <math alttext="100 milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="0.2 Molar N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> were combined, and <math alttext="M g, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> precipitated, as shown by the equation above. If the experiment is repeated using solutions of the same molarity, which of the following changes in volume will double the amount of <math alttext="M g, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> produced?

choices.label: Using the same volume of <math alttext="M g C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> but twice the volume of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Using twice the volume of <math alttext="M g C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> but half the volume of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Using twice the volume of <math alttext="M g C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> but the same volume of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Using twice the volume of <math alttext="M g C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and twice the volume of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Using twice the volume of <math alttext="M g C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and twice the volume of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
